You will experience the start-up environment in a stable global organizationWhen food marries tech - it’s just a promising industry We have a vibrant and international team with diverse backgroundsThis is a brand with competitive employees in an all hands on deck environment!We recognize top performers, welcome our newbies, and share good food!Competitive package, allowances, food perks, HMO, Insurance, and more!

Job Description   JOB DESCRIPTION:Reporting to the General Manager, the Head of Commercial Excellence is responsible for leading, managing and coordinating projects and initiatives as well as developing and implementing a consistent and high performing sales organisation to deliver on the strategy and long-term objectives of the affiliate.The role will:Liaise between the country leadership (and regional team) and the sales execution teams to drive transformational sales initiatives, enhance sales capabilities, and collaborate with the integrated business leaders for commercial execution. Success in the role will be evaluated based on sustained resultsDefine and implement a consistent sales strategy, assessing the country performance, identify initiatives for local implementation to align with regional commercial strategy and ensure efficiency and productivity. The focus should be to drive sales growth of the current as well as the future portfolio of EPD PhilippinesSupport the organization through ensuring that the affiliate has access to accurate, actionable data that is easy to use and readily accessible. Be a strong driver of data and insight-driven decision making throughout EPD. Core Job ResponsibilitiesIdentifies and executes detailed transformational sales initiatives and projects, bringing in best practices and insights from internal and external sources (market, competition and other industries) into the design.Assesses what the Philippines sales team needs to do differently, what capabilities this will require and how this compares with sales capabilities todayBuilds best in class sales capabilities and ensures best practice sharing with the commercial organization.Communicates commercial strategy into understandable and actionable priorities for sales teamsProvide the sales team with leadership, organization and direction to achieve business unit, brand, distribution channels and key account sales, market share goals, pricing, margin and expense targets.Institute and continue to re-engineer systems and procedures that would improve efficiency in operations of the EPD business by formulating sales strategies, developing each year a strategic and annual sales force productivity improvement plan optimizing headcount, territory definition, product responsibilities, training and technology investment.Lead sales team in preparation of annual sales targets, incentive targets, accounts and customer reach and call performance targets and regularly track performance, evaluate business, provide analysis and plan corrective actions.Ensure proper execution of marketing programs, brand promotion plans and field activities. Regularly monitors market environment: demand forecast, hospital/accounts data, competitor activities and customer feedbacks. Advise and assist the GM and Marketing management of customer and business issues related to growth, opportunities of business.Coach, train and develop National Sales Managers. Mentor high potential employees for future greater responsibility and maintain full, highest quality sales force, coaching them to improve performance.Develop and maintain rapport with key opinion leaders. Maintain excellent working relationships with all functional areas. Motivate sales team and ensure adherence to Class A standards and compliance to Abbott OEC standards.Close partnership with Head of Trade and Key Account Managers for comprehensive knowledge of market insights and customer understanding to conceptualize and execute divisional strategies and plans to set a foundation for above market growth.Support formulation of business cases for business development opportunities based on market insights. Involvement in setting direction and evaluating business opportunities to strengthen Abbott's portfolio and position as a preferred partner in the pharmaceuticals and OTC.Supervisory/Management ResponsibilitiesReports directly to General ManagerDrives growth of business revenueTotal headcount 8Minimum EducationPharmaceutical or Medical qualificationMBA from a reputed institute desirableMinimum Experience/Training RequiredHas at least 10 to 12 years of pharmaceutical/OTC/Consumer Health sales, most recently at a leadership level.Must have a proven experience in operating as part of a leadership team that places high emphasis on collaborative decision-making and high degree of accountabilityPrior experience in the Philippines or an Asian country of similar market dynamics.Skills and Competencies RequiredDevelop and communicate a clear Vision of growth and profitability strategy that can be translated into concrete action plans by sales leaders (Strategic Thinking, Vision Formulation, Communication)Create and sustain the needed organizational actions and momentum to successfully execute plans (Leadership, Communications, Drive for Results)Lead the thinking of the organization in identifying opportunity areas based on market needs, trends and competitive landscape that will guide current and future growth strategies (Strategic Thinking, Customer/Market Focus, Business Acumen)Build and expand the present capabilities of the HCP salesforce to the levels needed to achieve intended growth and differentiate the team over competitors (Organization building, People Development, Managing Change)Effectively oversee salesforce operation and ensures achievement of identified key performance metrics. Identify corrective actions to address performance gaps and ensures desired results are achieved (Leadership, Problem Solving, Drive for Results, Decisiveness, Coaching)

Job Description   Do you love food and convenience put together Then you will definitely lovefoodpanda!foodpanda brings good food into the everyday, whether delivering on our signature pink bikes or serving insights into the newest food trends and showcasing local favorite restaurants. We operate in 12 countries worldwide. Through the energy of our riders and the teams in all of our office spaces, we connect lovers of food to our brilliant partner restaurants. We're changing the way food delivery is viewed and experienced worldwide.We are the leading online food delivery service in the Asia-Pacific region with a wide variety of restaurant options. Operated by Delivery Hero, the global leader in the food delivery industry, processing over 1 million orders everyday and is operating in 40+ markets in the world, with 17,000 employees and approximately 200,000+ restaurant partners.This doesn't happen without our awesome people! We are looking for a Senior Partner Care Manager - Luzon (PH) to join our growing business! What's on the menu for you to do:You will lead a territory with a team of Partner Care Managers in Luzon to attain and exceed monthly and quarterly individual and team targetsYou should have the ability to lead by example and step in when and where needed to pitch, negotiate, and ultimately close deals for the team with a high level of expertise, professionalism, and serviceYou will manage and be responsible for the work relationship with the C & D vendors that will be assigned to the team through building good rapport, representing the company by being the vendors’ POC for their brand/s and ensuring vendor performance metrics are metYou will manage the commercial aspects of your team/vendor portfolio which calls for you to provide revenue-generating executions to the provided projects such as: renegotiation of commissions, getting vendor-funded deals, non-commission revenue itemsYou will be assigned to liaise with the different internal Departments on behalf of your team/vendor portfolio’s needs (ie. vendor has concerns with the Finance Team for their payment, you will follow the internal processes so you can respond to your vendor accordingly)You must follow all the internal processes and policies such as making sure your vendor portfolio’s details in the tools (Salesforce, backend, etc.) are up to date and accurateYou will analyze vendor performance to identify gaps and ensure that all vendors in your portfolio maintain a high customer experience standard; and if the performance is not within the thresholds, you will manage and help them achieve the metricsHire, train, and develop Partner Care Managers in selling strategy, product, presentation skills, soft skills, etc.Other tasks that may be assigned by the Manager/Head of Account Management/Commercial Director to ensure quota achievementWhat do you bring to the tableBachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Management, Marketing or equivalentPreferably a local of Luzon and has market knowledge of the area assignedMinimum of 2-3 years in sales or account management with demonstrated accomplishment of leading teams to consistently exceed targets and manage daily metricsStrong leadership skills to ensure both short- and long-term business goals, objectives, and targets are metPast sales experience in B2B, E-commerce, F&B, hotel and leisure, restaurant vendors, insurance, or pharmaceutical will be advantageousExperience with Salesforce is preferredGreat Interpersonal and communication skills; Strong negotiation skills is a plusStrong communication skills in English and Filipino What we have for you:We have a steep learning curve and because of that, not a day is boring here! This is a place for those looking for challenges, learning and fast growth. You will experience the start-up environment in a stable global organizationWhen food marries tech - it’s just a promising industry We have a vibrant and international team with diverse backgroundsThis is a brand with competitive employees in an all hands on deck environment!We recognize top performers, welcome our newbies, and share good food!Competitive package, allowances, food perks, HMO, Insurance, and more!

Job Description   Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.Job DescriptionThe Opportunity The customer is the focus of everything we do, and millions of end users rely on our products daily. We believe in the value of empowering Sales Leaders with the resources to solve critical problems for the future of our business, which is why we need you.Manulife Bancassurance Divisionisseeking a self-motivated Financial Sales Associate, who is obsessed with delivering value,isforward-thinking, and excited to see the successful client partnerships through the products and services that we offer.What motivates you You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefitYou think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile mindset and enable business outcomesYou thrive in teams, and enjoy getting things done togetherYou take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what mattersYou do what is right, work with integrity and speak upYou share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyoneWe are looking for someone with:Work experience in bancassurance sales is highly preferred for this position but those with sales and customer service experience gained from banking, transport, pharmaceutical, pre-need, hospitality and IT industries are also encouraged to apply.1 year sales experience preferably in a life insurance settingHas held key positions relevant to the requirement of the jobHigh sense of business ethics and professionalismNice to Haves:Strong business and financial acumenExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsPleasing personalityOn the job you will:Work closely with branch sales and service teams to provide innovative product solutions to address clients protection, long-term savings and investment needsStrengthen the long-term relationships with clients by providing excellent customer serviceOur commitment to you Our mission; to be a part of making Decisions Easier and Lives BetterA leadership team dedicated to your growth and successA bold ambition and set of goals to be a leader in driving transformation in our industryOur best. Every day.Learn more about opportunities with us at jobs.manulife.comIf you are ready to unleash your potential, it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock. About Manulife Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2020, we had more than 37,000 employees, over 118,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving over 30 million customers. As of December 31, 2020, we had $1.3 trillion (US$1.0 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $31.6 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as MFC on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under 945 in Hong Kong.Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention and advancement and we administer all of our practices and programs based on qualification and performance and without discrimination on any protected ground. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request any accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Job Description   Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for a Global Services Finance, Solutions Sr. Manager located in Manila, Philippines.Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 130 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.With $82.1 billion in 2019 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 260 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing over 135,000 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.The Global Services Finance, Solutions Sr. Manager is responsible for deployment of GS Finance projects globally. Such projects can include finance operating model, processes or technology.Reporting Relationship: Reports directly to: GS Finance Solutions DirectorPrincipal Accountabilities Solutions DevelopmentLead the solutions of specific finance projects with focus on the global services tier, including, but not limited to SigniFi initiativesLead solutions of the Continuous Improvement projects of the new operating model and specific GS Finance projects where applicableDevelop expertise on the Global Services Finance /Global Finance initiative(s) for which the specific position is aligned to (i.e. EPM, CFIN, TWT, etc.); understanding each program's strategies, outcome expectations, and implications to the GS Service Delivery organization; develop and drive Global solves that are compliant and executableAccountable for translating program strategies into GS Global & Regional solutions. Partner to understand, and become familiar with, the various regional Service Delivery nuances that need to be considered and accounted for as part of a global strategic Initiative design to ensure most appropriate Global Design; Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions including time and scope involvedAccountable of liaising between Service Delivery, Deployment Teams, Compliance, etc. back to strategic programs to help influence design principles, regional nuances, and other important considerations (i.e. language capabilities, skill sets, deployment considerations, etc.); Establish a framework for necessary contributions from various departments and facilitate their collaboration Accountable for understanding and providing overall ongoing Program/Initiative (strategy) updates to GSF/FS&T senior leadership against milestones, deployment teams, and other Key Stakeholders; Document and monitor requirements needed to institute proposed updates in relation to customer experienceResponsible for working alongside project management teams to successfully monitor progress and implementation of initiatives; Accountable for projecting possible project challenges or constraints and proactively seek to drive solves to manage challenges and communicate proper and timely updates to stakeholders Accountable for a smooth transition to new operating model with minimal disruption to the operations and the overall customer satisfaction during deployment processEnsure team members have the appropriate skills, supporting tools and technologies to enable them to deliver excellent customer serviceProvide leadership, coaching, training and guidance to team so they can proactively carry out their role to the highest possible standardManage and monitor team performance on a regular basisWork with global teams to ensure the organization is enabled to drive deeper standardization effortsAccountable for leveraging and collaborating across broader Central GS model and across the change & comms, training, HR, Compliance, FS&T & other workstreams, to bring a holistic deployment solution. QualificationsA bachelor's degree is required, Accounting or Finance is preferred A minimum of 7 years of related work experience in Finance is required 3 plus years of deployment, solutions, change management experience is desired Familiar with various Finance Operational Processes (A2R, ITC, etc.) May have responsibilities for managing teams, direct or indirect, as project needs ariseAbility to influence and interact with impact with Senior Leaders in GS and FinanceProject Leadership experienceAbility to leverage the capabilities across GS (i.e. Central Teams)

Job Description   Job Description :JOB SUMMARYAs the Talent Acquisition Specialist II you will serve as a strategic business partner to your customers while executing the full cycle recruitment for your assigned positions. You will partner closely with Hiring Managers to manage the recruiting process from end-to-end, developing strategies and implementing action plans related to both candidate sourcing identification and recruitment process execution. This includes but is not limited to: Educating and advising hiring managers to enable an effective and efficient recruiting process, identifying and sharing recruitment best practices across the business and industry, maintaining current market knowledge, legal and recruitment trends, and developing sourcing methodologies and strategies to target and identify qualified candidates.The successful candidate will be passionate about Syneos Health’s mission and culture, thrive in a fast paced environment, be proactive, resourceful and efficient. This person must be well organized, flexible, and enjoy the challenges of supporting a growing company. JOB RESPONSIBILITIESIn conjunction with all of Talent Acquisition, creates a deep and diverse talent pool to service resourcing requirements across multiple business units.Collaborates directly with hiring managers to understand business and skill set requirements to build a comprehensive strategic hiring plan by setting the vision, strategy, and goals to ensure current and future resource demands are met. As a strategic partner to your hiring managers, provide expertise in market insights, talent landscape, and an understanding of talent needs to establish expectations and build a collaborative approach with your customers to meet demands.Ensure customer satisfaction by providing regular updates to hiring managers and setting expectations on the hiring process per requisition or department, or both, as required.Utilize appropriate sourcing channels (including applicant tracking system, candidate relationship management system, job boards, advertising, networking, employee referral program) to identify qualified candidates.Monitor recruitment sourcing methods and provide recommendations to improve applicant attraction. Suggests innovative solutions to sourcing challenges and competitive intelligence from those efforts.Offers creative solutions to sourcing hard to fill requisitions in collaboration with the business. Responsible to manage full cycle recruiting process to include but not limited to: complete initial screening interview of potential candidates and reject non-relevant applications, prepare candidate profile for hiring manager following interview screen, submit short listed candidates to hiring managers for review, conducts candidate debrief session after interviews are completed and extends verbal offers of employment to successful candidates.Ensures data accuracy within Applicant Tracking System. Initiates and maintains open communication with hiring managers and Human Resources (HR) colleagues in meeting recruiting needs.May create collateral HR materials for trade shows, professional organization meetings, and career fairs. May attend trade shows, professional organization meetings and career fairs.May provide training and coaching activities for Talent Acquisition Specialists.Performs other job-related duties as assignedQualificationsQUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience Experience as a Talent Acquisition Specialist / Recruiter in a corporate or agency environmentProven track record in direct sourcing and managing an end-to-end recruiting process requiredDemonstrated leadership skills Strong business acumen and demonstrated ability to think and influence strategicallyProven track record in utilizing creative recruitment techniques and measurement of results Ability to work well with multi-functional team and with all levels within organizationStrong problem solving, influencing, negotiating, facilitating and partnership skills requiredAbility to effectively engage and build relationships with line management, employees, and HR team at all levels Excellent organizational skills and ability to effectively manage multiple demands without missing deadlinesStrong time management skills and able to work independentlyProficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). Strong written and oral communication skillsStrong customer services skillsStrong attention to detail and an ability to maintain confidentiality Preferred QualificationsExperience as a full cycle Talent Acquisition Specialist / Recruiter supporting a CRO or in the Pharmaceutical industryExperience working in Taleo Experience with a CRM

Job Title: Activation Marketing Specialist - Health Care Business
Job Description: Job Description   3M has a long-standing reputation as a company committed to innovation. We provide the freedom to explore and encourage curiosity and creativity. We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas. Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter.Job Description:The purpose of the role is local activation and engagement to drive demand generation (end-user, segments, through channel, sales enablement); provide relevant insights, input into area and global segment, portfolio and product teams.Individual Accountabilities1.) Demand generation locally:Identify opportunities and needs to leverage local social media/media/key platforms for communicationsExecute on end-user communicationsMake recommendation on media buys aligned to the global and area activation plans2.) Channel:Syndication to the channel partner in countryRepresent eCommerce capabilities and expectations of channel partnersGeneral channel partners distribution, local specific channel partner engagement/execution of through channel marketing plansSales partnership and engagement:Delivering programs/promotions/new product materials to field salesClose alignment/partnership with sales teams to deliver programs3.) Marketing updates:Owner of the audience evolution - aggregate view of the local audience and articulating that to the area through Area Business Group Marketing Center, Region/Country Business Group or Division LeadersProduct Support: New product translation correctness and local requirement management, local material ownersPromotion planning (IBP process input) as defined by the IBP process and IBP process ownerRepresent and ensure local marketing requirements are understood and managed: trade shows, customer events, key opinion leaders.Deliver new product material, programs and promotions to sales aligned to global and area programs.Creating new materials or programs only aligned to those strategies and when approved.4.) Input to the area teams (area portfolio, NPI and area segment marketing):Provide input to marketing planning, programCompetitive intelligence, customer, KOL and media platform trendsEnsure local regulatory and packaging compliance for portfolios/programsAlign to campaign outcomes/input/resultsNPI voice of market, ideas, local needs, participate on global NPI team/with area new product marketers5.)Promotion support:Responsible for confirming translation correctness, as well as regulatory and legal alignment according to local and business laws and guidanceInterface with local application engineers, professional services and specialists on technical, whitepapers, customer testimonials and ensuring meets customer requirements to local regulations and requirementsManage local calendar for promotional planning and implementationQualifications:Bachelor's Degree in MarketingRelevant work experience within Health Care/Pharmaceutical/Medical Device industryWork Location: BGC Area, TaguigLearn more about 3M's creative solutions to the world's problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy StatementCarefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.Please access the linked document by clicking select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.

Job Description   Job Description :Job Summary: A SOC Analyst III will be able to complete advanced log reviews, lead Incident Response cases, assistwith technology review, report creation and improvement, and Audit remediation.Duties/Responsibilities: A SOC Analyst III will have an advanced understanding of the Teleperformance network layout, and an advancedunderstanding of the functionality of the tools in use. SOC Analyst III will be able to create and explainreports.SOC Analyst II responsibilities include all those of SOC Analyst I and SOC Analyst II, in addition tothe responsibilities as outlined below: Demonstrated to advanced operational experience as a Cyber Threat Hunter.Demonstrated to advanced experience with computer networking and operating systems.Demonstrated to advanced experience of current threats, vulnerabilities, and attack trends.Insider Threat.Application Security.Malware Reverse Engineering.Advanced Log Review tasks.Forensic Investigation.Audit interview participation.Advanced Splunk knowledge.Other responsibilities as assigned.Technical Understanding.Full understanding of the OSI model.Intermediate Network Skills.Advanced Scripting knowledge.Advanced Window Knowledge.Intermediate Linux skills.Live forensic.Offline forensic.Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering or a related discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical training or work/military experience.5+ years of Information Security/Risk Management experience.Intermediate understand of OSI model.Application, System and Network security best practice knowledgeAdvanced knowledge and Work experience in Security Operations or related fields such as Audit, IT Security, or Business Continuity, however other IT disciplines are eligible.Technical knowledge to understand detailed issues around business continuity, security, and overall risk in IT. Able to have enough expertise to drive a solution and solve issues, addressing risk.Experience managing a team in a high paced environment.One or more of the following certifications or ability to obtain one in near future: CEH, CISSP, CRISC, CISA, ECSA, CHFI, CFE, MCSE, CCNA, CCNP.Preferred Skills. Experience in a regulated (financial, pharmaceutical, health care, etc.) industry is highly desired.Experience with regulatory requirements including but not limited to PCI-DSS, ISO2700, HIPAA, etc.

Job Description   JOB DESCRIPTION:The Finance Director is responsible for translating the affiliate's business strategy into specific financial policies and systems; compile, review, analyze, comment and report financial information, adequately responding to the business needs of the stakeholders and the group in general, in order to ensure that Abbott International Nutrition (ANI) comply with all financial laws and (internal and external) regulations and to contribute to optimize business decisions and strategies.The position is responsible for managing and leading the supply chain operations, directly directing supply chain processes, championing supply chain initiatives and promoting best practices and strategies. The position ensures the effective implementation and execution of all supply chain functions which include: demand management, inventory management, procurement and logistics, third party manufacturing, building and fleet management. The position is also responsible for spearheading business excellence initiatives to promote process improvement in the company.Direct Reports (indicate number): 3- 1 Executive Assistant 1 Sr. Demand and Business Excellence Manager 1 Finance ControllerKey Areas of Accountability:Strategic OrientationThe Finance Director is responsible for translating the affiliate's Business Strategy into specific financial policies and systems.He/She measures the performance of the Subsidiary in strategic, financial and operational KPIs according to Group StandardsHe/She recommends or challenges the strategic orientation of the affiliate in order to ensure the most profitable growth of the Business.Cost/ Investment optimization processProductivity optimizationResponsible for the working capital of the affiliateHe/She supports the management in the implementation of Subsidiary internal projects especially: New Product Application, Productivity Plan (organization), information system and acquisition of new products.Coordination and SupervisionSupervise the local financial processesSupervise and plan for the availability of products at the Distributor's levelAlignment of corporate processes through proactive and regular contacts with HQ.Strategic ReportingCoordinate with reporting process locally and at the HQ's level (Budget, monthly and quarterly reporting) by bringing added- value information and recommendations to the Management.Demand ManagementCollaborate with marketing and sales group to generate best estimates of market demand at a particular point in timeChallenge the feasibility of market demand assumptions to ensure that Historical and current realities such as volume, pricing, target customer and product factors are taken into considerationIdentify gaps and develop strategies to close the gaps that exist between the sales forecast (demand) and the operations plan (supply)Manage relationships with distributors to ensure that sales targets are met and that stocks are properly allocated.Inventory ManagementDirects planning strategies, initiatives and methodologies to optimize inventory levels.Ensure compliance to product quality and safety standards, policies and procedures and specifications for raw materials, production processes and finished goods inventory.Manage full monthly supply situation and optimize supply utilization tp ensure that sales targets and customer demands are met.Procurement managementLead the development of procurement processes to ensure reliable sources of supply, improve service and quality and reduce cost and supplier lead times.Knowledge & Experience:Must have a vast knowledge in the following areas:Financial Planning processGeneral AccountingAccounting standardsSupply Chain Management Best PracticesProcurement ProcessInventory Management ProcessDemand Management ProcessFinance Management ProcessKnowledge in pharmaceutical sector is a plusMinimum of 10 years of experience followed by a significant exposure in an international groupCompetencies required:Analytical Thinking Initiative Conceptual Thinking Information Gathering Business Awareness Customer Care Developing others Holding people accountable Networking Teamwork Decisiveness CompetitivenessMinimum Qualification:Must be a college graduate of a Business school/MBA or equivalent with Finance Specialization

Job Title: Consultant - Strategy & Business Design (Monitor Deloitte) - PH 1
Job Description: Job Description   What impact will you make At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.Work you will do We are seeking exceptional, highly skilled individuals to join Monitor Deloitte as a full time Senior consultant. At Monitor Deloitte you will be working in a team to solve complex client issues that span across different sectors and geographies in SE Asia.Founded in 1983 by six entrepreneurs, Monitor Deloitte's Purpose is 'to shape the future by helping clients create new value in a dynamic world.' A global management consulting firm, we bring cutting-edge ideas, approaches and methods to bear on clients toughest problems and biggest opportunities. Specifically, we provide to ambitious leaders and organizations advisory and capability-building services that unlock the challenges of achieving sustained growth by pursuing the new opportunities inherent in the complexity and dynamism of our times.Monitor Deloitte works with the world's leading and most ambitious corporations, governments and social sector organizations to drive growth on the issues that are most important to them. To that end, the firm has developed client advisory content and services in the areas we think are critical to growth: corporate and business unit strategy, marketing and sales, organization and leadership, innovation, national economic development, and social impact.Monitor Deloitte's client engagements are predominantly in industries and organizations facing important—often profound—transitions. Monitor Deloitte typically works with CEOs, business unit heads and other members of the senior management team. Client engagements may be as short as a few months, but often evolve into multi-year, wide-ranging and transformative relationships. Job ResponsibilitiesThe Senior Consultant is responsible for managing a discreet workstream (or module) within a broader project. For instance, on a growth strategy project for a pharmaceutical company, one module may be focused on conducting expert interviews and secondary research to understand key market trends, another on gaining a better understanding of unmet patient needs, and a third on developing financial forecasts of the future performance of existing lines of business. The number of modules varies from case to case, and depends on the of the team and the scope of the project. Similarly, the number of consultants assigned to a module varies based on the level of complexity of the work.Senior Consultants frequently manage one or more junior consultants. Their responsibilities can include:• Working with Partners, Managers, and clients to develop hypotheses and work plans that address project objectives;• Managing data collection and analysis;• Developing insights from the analytical process and integrating the module's findings into the broader project work;• Communicating analysis and recommendations in both written and oral communication with internal and client leadership;• Building the relationship between Monitor Deloitte and the client's project team;• Providing professional development opportunities and feedback for Consultants.Enough about us, let's talk about youIf you are someone with:• MBA degree from top tier academic institution• Minimum 4 yrs of experience in strategy consulting• A base level of knowledge in business strategy, marketing, finance, operations, and data analysis techniques;• Excellent academic credentials for both undergraduate and graduate coursework;• Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal;• Leadership qualities, project management skills, and the ability to mentor;• Willingness and ability to take initiative and learn independently;• Candidates from all academic backgrounds are encouraged to apply.Positions may be based in Philippines but project locations could be anywhere in the Asia-Pacific Region.Next Steps So what are you waiting for Join the winning team now.Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

About Manulife Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2020, we had more than 37,000 employees, over 118,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving over 30 million customers. As of December 31, 2020, we had $1.3 trillion (US$1.0 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $31.6 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as MFC on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under 945 in Hong Kong.Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. Job Description   JOB DESCRIPTION:The position is responsible for Abbott Nutrition (ANI) Third-Party Logistics (3PL) Warehouse & Transportations operations for Finished and Semi- finished goods, Samples and Promotional Materials and Reverse logistics ensuring accurate and on-time delivery to Abbott Internal and External Customers.Designed to capitalize on strategic opportunities, drive process innovation and operational excellence throughout the 3PL warehouse & transportation operations, ensuring optimum network logistics solutions.Key Areas of AccountabilityA. Leads and influence 3PL - create environment for continued high performance, day-to-day guidance on operations and effective performance management of the 3PL warehouse & transportation provider for the ffg; areas;Cycle Count - 3PL actual count, variance reporting & analysis.IHIR (In house Inspection Report) & RGIR (Return Goods Inspection report) - 3PL analysis & validation of reports prior to Abbott Q.A inspection.SGR (Spoiled Goods Report) - reporting of expired goods as well as Q.A approved goods for destruction.DO (Delivery Order) - 3PL inventory posting of Redressing Receipt (RR) and Redressing Issuance (RI) including 3PL reconciliations of VAS transaction.Inventory adjustment posting approval - Write off (short pack, recovered RG's, overage, destructed Spoiled Goods(SGR)) Redressing Issuance (for VAS transaction), Cycle Count Adj. (Lot #, Qty., adjustment), Samples Issuance (outbound samples inventory transaction).Item Masterfile maintenance - Updating of product item dimension and EDI load compile input data.Conduct Inventory Analysis prior to Month end System Closing.B. Warehouse capacity planning - meet demand, short and long-term forecasting and planning for distribution requirements, analyze orders and mitigate risk. Provide support in maintaining logistics planning tasks. Coordination to supply planning, TPM's and 3PL for stocks movement and pull outs.Monitor 3PL Transport planning to make sure full truck space utilization.Monitor Manual Stock Transfers on time and accurate System Posting.Monitor Actual Pallet Utilization and manage correct timing of Incoming Shipments in accordance to stock level targets.Monitor warehouse and Logistics KPI's. Works with 3PL to address issueC. Ownership and Supervision of all relevant processes and tools to ensure effective warehouse distribution management - improve all relevant operating processes, adhere to standards requirements and evaluate cost efficient operating tools Review and updates logistics policies and procedure consistent to warehouse and distribution current practice.Audit/report to direct managers any deviation from logistics policies and procedures.D. Financials & claims - Monitors and validate actual 3PL billing of all Warehouse and Logistics related cost if within the agreed contracted service level.Investigate 3PL inventory divergence, resolve issues and update database to replicate property movement.Insurance claims - raise as necessary claims against 3PL for product damage, variances aligned with the contract.E. Collaborate with Internal and external business functions and stakeholders to effectively manage, identify and meet business requirements at a tactical level.Lead 3PL Samples and Promotional materials warehouse operations. Coordinate with Purchasing, Supply Planning, Finance and Marketing on the documentation for the correct and immediate posting of Sample products and Promat's distribution. Make sure compliance of 3PL on the agreed KPI's on delivery of samples, Inventory record accuracy and space utilization.Monitor 3PL Reverse Logistics & Return Goods operations on receiving, witnessing/inspection, destruction and reporting, documentation requirements consistent to Abbott RG policy.Audit 3PL security and storage for all return products while awaiting disposal for nutritional powders and destruction for nutritional liquids/pharmaceutical goods. Make sure segregation and standard palletization is being followed in order not to exceed for the allowable pallet storage space.Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)Inventory Record Accuracy (IRA)Transportation and Delivery (TD)3PL Pallet UtilizationShared KPI: Customer Service Level (CSL)Knowledge & SkillsWarehouse and Distribution Management, MRP systemComputer literacyStrong organizational and administration skillsCompetenciesPassionate, eager to learnAbility to work under pressure and to tight schedulesConfident and assertiveProfessional attitude and demeanorAdaptable / Flexible approach to workMinimum QualificationsMinimum of 3 years experience on logistics management within an MRP environmentExcellent understanding of efficient materials flow and best practice.High level of computer literacy, to include MS Power Point, Word, Excel and Outlook

At the end of 2020, we had more than 37,000 employees, over 118,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving over 30 million customers. As of December 31, 2020, we had $1.3 trillion (US$1.0 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $31.6 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as MFC on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under 945 in Hong Kong.Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention and advancement and we administer all of our practices and programs based on qualification and performance and without discrimination on any protected ground. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request any accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Company: Teletech Customer Care Management Philippiness Inc
Job Description: Job Description   Job Description :TeleTech is on the search for a USRN Healthcare Professionalto proactively create meaningful connections with our team.You became a nurse to support others. You have the empathy and the drive. And nursing can also be a challenging field. It is this passion for helping others that makes you the best at what you do. Why not consider a change of scenery. TTEC is actively hiring US RNs (nurse with NCLEX certification) to support customers of pharmaceutical organizations who need you.Now, more than ever, how we connect is everything. Our purpose is to deliver humanity to business – and it's more relevant than ever before in today’s environment. We know we’re stronger together, working towards a purpose that matters. As TeleTech team members we lift each other up, deliver smiles, and support our communities. Join us in our commitment to deliver amazing experiences.Why You What you bringConnections are everything here at TeleTech. That means we connect with our customers, our teammates and most importantly with you. And the ability to connect yourself is what you bring to the table… along with the following:• Active unrestricted USRN license• 2+ years clinical experience in a hospital, acute care, home health / hospice, direct care or case management preferred• Exceptional English verbal and written communication skills• Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment• Previous customer service or Clinical Process Outsourcing experience is a plusWhat you'll be doing:Do you have a sincere sense of empathy and care for others Health issues are life-altering whether its dealing with a loved one’s health concern or providing the best medical care possible. We trust that you are equipped with the acumen that comprise a top-notch medical professional – caring, empathic and compassionate in nature. Your strong knowledge to interpret, review and advise is vital to determine appropriate alternatives that help patients through their difficulties. You'll also have a chance to make great new friends and grow your career in a high-energy, family-friendly atmosphere.What your typical day will consist of:• Interact with pharmacy technicians, physicians, and colleagues from other departments• Respond to internal inquiries with compassion and active listening and select the best solution in an efficient manner• Gather clinical information, criteria information and work within regulatory guidelines• Positively participate in company events, in team meetings, and support your peersWhat you'll enjoy:• A competitive salary package up to ₱45,000• Company-sponsored HMO with Health & Wellness programs for you and your family• Educational assistance through tuition reimbursement• And more.Accepting digital applications for your protection and the protection of our employees: Apply online or text ‘TTEC’ to +63 922 110 1170 to connect with us.

Job Description   At Roche, 94,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we've become one of the world's leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.At Roche, we work with a purpose - developing innovative tests and medicines, and using data in new ways to help people to live longer, better lives. We have been writing scientific history for more than 120 years, and our work impacts millions of patients every day, now and in the futureRoche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building teams that represent a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.We are looking for a talented supply chain associate to lead strategic initiatives, process improvement and at the same time hands ready to take one some part of the transactional activities. The main responsibilities include:Contribute to supply chain strategy design and deployment. Optimize inventory to achieve objectives and targetsDrive process improvement in the end to end supply chain (from supply forecast until inventory management at the account/hospital) and review flow of goodsDrive service performance of distributor/s and other third party supply chain partners (end to end)Contribute to transactional tasksThe RoleDrive strategic projects (including SAP) related to supply chain to ensure continuity of the supply in the accounts and avoid stock out. The portion of strategic project will progressively increase in light of portfolio evolution and SAP backbone evolution.Contribute to the monthly cross-functional Sales and Operations (S&OP) meeting to review key performance indicators, flag risks and identify opportunities to meet business objectives.Contribute to the commercial/regulatory teams to provide quality market intelligence, validating forecast assumptions to improve forecast accuracy. Develop demand scenarios to close financial forecast gaps.Identify and lead the delivery of continuous improvement initiatives. Including but not limited to logistics flows for different existing programs.Review inventory level across the supply chain, identify risks, opportunities and drive optimization. Identify and flag supply issues, collaborating with global/regional/local teams to manage and mitigate any supply shortage.Work closely with global/regional/local teams to ensure timely and efficient supply of products, including availability of new products for launches.Monitor targets for key performance indicators and drive effective performance management of service, inventory and costDesign and implement a distribution management frameworkCollaborate with global/regional teams to develop supply chain strategies, bringing innovation and integrated solutions to the network (e.g. ASPIRE, Supply Chain Transformation).Who you areDegree in Business/Finance/Supply Chain Logistics discipline or equivalentAt least 7-8 years experience in Supply Chain / Customer Service in Process Industries (e.g. Pharma, Medical Devices, Fast Moving Consumer Goods, etc.)Verbal and written English communicationAdvanced level of computer literacy in MS Office programs, i.e. Word, PPT, Excel, OutlookExpertise in SAPWhy RocheBe part of a winning companyWorking at Roche means working at the forefront of innovation. Our cutting-edge technologies and healthcare solutions are occasionally developed with unconventional methods but always with the highest standard of quality in mind.Our Diagnostic division is the world leader in in-vitro diagnostics.Our Pharmaceutical Division is the No. 1 supplier of cancer medicines.Our Performance CultureAs we keep reinventing ourselves, we depend on our people to take the initiative and push ahead.We look at competencies across functions and geographies, you'll certainly be able to align your interests with our business needs.We believe in having our employees share in the success of the company and offer people the opportunity to take ownership with our employee share plan (currently available in 41 countries).An inspiring work environmentWe foster a culture of debate, mutual respect, and diversity to encourage open discussion and new ideas.Feedback is one of the core elements of our culture, as sharing knowledge promotes the development of new ideas, a key competitive strength of ours.Our focus is on natural, long-term growth, driven by the contributions of our talented and committed people. We leave you the space you need to meet your personal goals, meet your family obligations, and pursue your professional development.We have a variety of site-specific flexible working models.Be inspired by who we are, what we do and how we do it.Visit to learn more about Roche.Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

Job Title: Activation Marketing Specialist - Health Care Business
Job Description: Job Description   3M has a long-standing reputation as a company committed to innovation. We provide the freedom to explore and encourage curiosity and creativity. We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas. Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter.Job Description:The purpose of the role is local activation and engagement to drive demand generation (end-user, segments, through channel, sales enablement); provide relevant insights, input into area and global segment, portfolio and product teams.Individual Accountabilities1.) Demand generation locally:Identify opportunities and needs to leverage local social media/media/key platforms for communicationsExecute on end-user communicationsMake recommendation on media buys aligned to the global and area activation plans2.) Channel:Syndication to the channel partner in countryRepresent eCommerce capabilities and expectations of channel partnersGeneral channel partners distribution, local specific channel partner engagement/execution of through channel marketing plansSales partnership and engagement:Delivering programs/promotions/new product materials to field salesClose alignment/partnership with sales teams to deliver programs3.) Marketing updates:Owner of the audience evolution - aggregate view of the local audience and articulating that to the area through Area Business Group Marketing Center, Region/Country Business Group or Division LeadersProduct Support: New product translation correctness and local requirement management, local material ownersPromotion planning (IBP process input) as defined by the IBP process and IBP process ownerRepresent and ensure local marketing requirements are understood and managed: trade shows, customer events, key opinion leaders.Deliver new product material, programs and promotions to sales aligned to global and area programs.Creating new materials or programs only aligned to those strategies and when approved.4.) Input to the area teams (area portfolio, NPI and area segment marketing):Provide input to marketing planning, programCompetitive intelligence, customer, KOL and media platform trendsEnsure local regulatory and packaging compliance for portfolios/programsAlign to campaign outcomes/input/resultsNPI voice of market, ideas, local needs, participate on global NPI team/with area new product marketers5.)Promotion support:Responsible for confirming translation correctness, as well as regulatory and legal alignment according to local and business laws and guidanceInterface with local application engineers, professional services and specialists on technical, whitepapers, customer testimonials and ensuring meets customer requirements to local regulations and requirementsManage local calendar for promotional planning and implementationQualifications:Bachelor's Degree in MarketingRelevant work experience within Health Care/Pharmaceutical/Medical Device industryWork Location: BGC Area, TaguigLearn more about 3M's creative solutions to the world's problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy StatementCarefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.Please access the linked document by clicking select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.

Job Title: Consultant - Strategy & Business Design (Monitor Deloitte) - PH 1
Job Description: Job Description   What impact will you make At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.Work you will do We are seeking exceptional, highly skilled individuals to join Monitor Deloitte as a full time Senior consultant. At Monitor Deloitte you will be working in a team to solve complex client issues that span across different sectors and geographies in SE Asia.Founded in 1983 by six entrepreneurs, Monitor Deloitte's Purpose is 'to shape the future by helping clients create new value in a dynamic world.' A global management consulting firm, we bring cutting-edge ideas, approaches and methods to bear on clients toughest problems and biggest opportunities. Specifically, we provide to ambitious leaders and organizations advisory and capability-building services that unlock the challenges of achieving sustained growth by pursuing the new opportunities inherent in the complexity and dynamism of our times.Monitor Deloitte works with the world's leading and most ambitious corporations, governments and social sector organizations to drive growth on the issues that are most important to them. To that end, the firm has developed client advisory content and services in the areas we think are critical to growth: corporate and business unit strategy, marketing and sales, organization and leadership, innovation, national economic development, and social impact.Monitor Deloitte's client engagements are predominantly in industries and organizations facing important—often profound—transitions. Monitor Deloitte typically works with CEOs, business unit heads and other members of the senior management team. Client engagements may be as short as a few months, but often evolve into multi-year, wide-ranging and transformative relationships. Job ResponsibilitiesThe Senior Consultant is responsible for managing a discreet workstream (or module) within a broader project. For instance, on a growth strategy project for a pharmaceutical company, one module may be focused on conducting expert interviews and secondary research to understand key market trends, another on gaining a better understanding of unmet patient needs, and a third on developing financial forecasts of the future performance of existing lines of business. The number of modules varies from case to case, and depends on the of the team and the scope of the project. Similarly, the number of consultants assigned to a module varies based on the level of complexity of the work.Senior Consultants frequently manage one or more junior consultants. Their responsibilities can include:• Working with Partners, Managers, and clients to develop hypotheses and work plans that address project objectives;• Managing data collection and analysis;• Developing insights from the analytical process and integrating the module's findings into the broader project work;• Communicating analysis and recommendations in both written and oral communication with internal and client leadership;• Building the relationship between Monitor Deloitte and the client's project team;• Providing professional development opportunities and feedback for Consultants.Enough about us, let's talk about youIf you are someone with:• MBA degree from top tier academic institution• Minimum 4 yrs of experience in strategy consulting• A base level of knowledge in business strategy, marketing, finance, operations, and data analysis techniques;• Excellent academic credentials for both undergraduate and graduate coursework;• Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal;• Leadership qualities, project management skills, and the ability to mentor;• Willingness and ability to take initiative and learn independently;• Candidates from all academic backgrounds are encouraged to apply.Positions may be based in Philippines but project locations could be anywhere in the Asia-Pacific Region.Next Steps So what are you waiting for Join the winning team now.Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description   JOB DESCRIPTION:The Finance Director is responsible for translating the affiliate's business strategy into specific financial policies and systems; compile, review, analyze, comment and report financial information, adequately responding to the business needs of the stakeholders and the group in general, in order to ensure that Abbott International Nutrition (ANI) comply with all financial laws and (internal and external) regulations and to contribute to optimize business decisions and strategies.The position is responsible for managing and leading the supply chain operations, directly directing supply chain processes, championing supply chain initiatives and promoting best practices and strategies. The position ensures the effective implementation and execution of all supply chain functions which include: demand management, inventory management, procurement and logistics, third party manufacturing, building and fleet management. The position is also responsible for spearheading business excellence initiatives to promote process improvement in the company.Direct Reports (indicate number): 3- 1 Executive Assistant 1 Sr. Demand and Business Excellence Manager 1 Finance ControllerKey Areas of Accountability:Strategic OrientationThe Finance Director is responsible for translating the affiliate's Business Strategy into specific financial policies and systems.He/She measures the performance of the Subsidiary in strategic, financial and operational KPIs according to Group StandardsHe/She recommends or challenges the strategic orientation of the affiliate in order to ensure the most profitable growth of the Business.Cost/ Investment optimization processProductivity optimizationResponsible for the working capital of the affiliateHe/She supports the management in the implementation of Subsidiary internal projects especially: New Product Application, Productivity Plan (organization), information system and acquisition of new products.Coordination and SupervisionSupervise the local financial processesSupervise and plan for the availability of products at the Distributor's levelAlignment of corporate processes through proactive and regular contacts with HQ.Strategic ReportingCoordinate with reporting process locally and at the HQ's level (Budget, monthly and quarterly reporting) by bringing added- value information and recommendations to the Management.Demand ManagementCollaborate with marketing and sales group to generate best estimates of market demand at a particular point in timeChallenge the feasibility of market demand assumptions to ensure that Historical and current realities such as volume, pricing, target customer and product factors are taken into considerationIdentify gaps and develop strategies to close the gaps that exist between the sales forecast (demand) and the operations plan (supply)Manage relationships with distributors to ensure that sales targets are met and that stocks are properly allocated.Inventory ManagementDirects planning strategies, initiatives and methodologies to optimize inventory levels.Ensure compliance to product quality and safety standards, policies and procedures and specifications for raw materials, production processes and finished goods inventory.Manage full monthly supply situation and optimize supply utilization tp ensure that sales targets and customer demands are met.Procurement managementLead the development of procurement processes to ensure reliable sources of supply, improve service and quality and reduce cost and supplier lead times.Knowledge & Experience:Must have a vast knowledge in the following areas:Financial Planning processGeneral AccountingAccounting standardsSupply Chain Management Best PracticesProcurement ProcessInventory Management ProcessDemand Management ProcessFinance Management ProcessKnowledge in pharmaceutical sector is a plusMinimum of 10 years of experience followed by a significant exposure in an international groupCompetencies required:Analytical Thinking Initiative Conceptual Thinking Information Gathering Business Awareness Customer Care Developing others Holding people accountable Networking Teamwork Decisiveness CompetitivenessMinimum Qualification:Must be a college graduate of a Business school/MBA or equivalent with Finance Specialization

About Manulife Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2020, we had more than 37,000 employees, over 118,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving over 30 million customers. As of December 31, 2020, we had $1.3 trillion (US$1.0 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $31.6 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as MFC on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under 945 in Hong Kong.Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention and advancement and we administer all of our practices and programs based on qualification and performance and without discrimination on any protected ground. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request any accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Job Description   Job Description :Job Summary: The Security Analyst is responsible for maintaining, improving, and monitoring the security environment by understanding generally accepted security and risk principles and applying this knowledge to the existing environment and processes. The Security Analyst will be assigned to a region and is expected to understand all of the data security and privacy policies, procedures and the overall architecture as they apply to the region.The Security Analyst coordinates with the Operations and Information Technology organizations to ensure compliance with corporate security policies, processes and procedures and is responsible for the implementation of security best practices, client requirements, regulatory and global security requirements.The successful candidate will coordinate projects by developing the security risk requirements and acting as the security point of contact for both internal groups and external clients. In this role, the Security Analyst will define security frameworks, communicate security concepts, policies, standards, procedures, and provide ongoing support.The successful candidate will have a firm understanding of risk management principles and can easily articulate that understanding while helping others to improve. Is willing to actively seek opportunities to develop new approaches to meet new goals. Grasps and applies advanced concepts. Stays abreast of new tools, technologies, and techniques, and implements them as solutions to business and technical problems.The Senior Security Analyst is expected to be able to mentor and provide leadership to others on the team.Duties/Responsibilities: Align current business processes with client requirements and external security standards/obligations such as Visa PCI DSS, ISO27001 and ISO27002, HIPAA, BITS, etc.Identifying and remedying security deficiencies and gaps with business suitable controls.Works with global security team in the creation of policies, procedures, or guidelines to ensure the security and privacy of information and computer systems for Teleperformance.Review Statements of Work, Master Service Agreements, and other contracts for security obligations and identify areas of exposureServe as liaison between operations and management to maximize the adoption of and support for security plans and procedures within the organization.Recommend physical security controls and processesServe as primary liaison between the organizations clients and security auditors, concerning information security and privacy incidents, laws, and policies.Conduct Risk Assessment including but not limited to Fraud Risk Assessment.Identify and lead the appropriate subject matter experts to participate in the identification and analysis of risk scenarios.Participate in BCP/DR related activities.Will be called upon to provide innovative risk management solutionsCompletes all special projects and other duties as assigned.Qualifications: A Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering or a related discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical training or work/military experience.5 or more years of Information Security/Risk Management experienceExperience with regulatory requirements including but not limited to PCI-DSS, ISO2700, HIPAA, etc.Advanced knowledge and Work experience in Risk Management or related fields such as Audit, IT Security, or Business Continuity, however other IT disciplines are eligible.Technical knowledge to understand detailed issues around business continuity, security, and overall risk in IT. Able to have enough expertise to drive a solution and solve issues, addressing risk.Preferred Skills:Experience in a regulated (financial, pharmaceutical, health care, etc.) industry is highly desired.One or more of the following certifications is highly preferred: CEH, CISSP, CRISC, CISA, ECSA, CHFI, CFE, MCSE, CCNA, and CCNP.

Job Description   JOB DESCRIPTION:The position is responsible for Abbott Nutrition (ANI) Third-Party Logistics (3PL) Warehouse & Transportations operations for Finished and Semi- finished goods, Samples and Promotional Materials and Reverse logistics ensuring accurate and on-time delivery to Abbott Internal and External Customers.Designed to capitalize on strategic opportunities, drive process innovation and operational excellence throughout the 3PL warehouse & transportation operations, ensuring optimum network logistics solutions.Key Areas of AccountabilityA. Leads and influence 3PL - create environment for continued high performance, day-to-day guidance on operations and effective performance management of the 3PL warehouse & transportation provider for the ffg; areas;Cycle Count - 3PL actual count, variance reporting & analysis.IHIR (In house Inspection Report) & RGIR (Return Goods Inspection report) - 3PL analysis & validation of reports prior to Abbott Q.A inspection.SGR (Spoiled Goods Report) - reporting of expired goods as well as Q.A approved goods for destruction.DO (Delivery Order) - 3PL inventory posting of Redressing Receipt (RR) and Redressing Issuance (RI) including 3PL reconciliations of VAS transaction.Inventory adjustment posting approval - Write off (short pack, recovered RG's, overage, destructed Spoiled Goods(SGR)) Redressing Issuance (for VAS transaction), Cycle Count Adj. (Lot #, Qty., adjustment), Samples Issuance (outbound samples inventory transaction).Item Masterfile maintenance - Updating of product item dimension and EDI load compile input data.Conduct Inventory Analysis prior to Month end System Closing.B. Warehouse capacity planning - meet demand, short and long-term forecasting and planning for distribution requirements, analyze orders and mitigate risk. Provide support in maintaining logistics planning tasks. Coordination to supply planning, TPM's and 3PL for stocks movement and pull outs.Monitor 3PL Transport planning to make sure full truck space utilization.Monitor Manual Stock Transfers on time and accurate System Posting.Monitor Actual Pallet Utilization and manage correct timing of Incoming Shipments in accordance to stock level targets.Monitor warehouse and Logistics KPI's. Works with 3PL to address issueC. Ownership and Supervision of all relevant processes and tools to ensure effective warehouse distribution management - improve all relevant operating processes, adhere to standards requirements and evaluate cost efficient operating tools Review and updates logistics policies and procedure consistent to warehouse and distribution current practice.Audit/report to direct managers any deviation from logistics policies and procedures.D. Financials & claims - Monitors and validate actual 3PL billing of all Warehouse and Logistics related cost if within the agreed contracted service level.Investigate 3PL inventory divergence, resolve issues and update database to replicate property movement.Insurance claims - raise as necessary claims against 3PL for product damage, variances aligned with the contract.E. Collaborate with Internal and external business functions and stakeholders to effectively manage, identify and meet business requirements at a tactical level.Lead 3PL Samples and Promotional materials warehouse operations. Coordinate with Purchasing, Supply Planning, Finance and Marketing on the documentation for the correct and immediate posting of Sample products and Promat's distribution. Make sure compliance of 3PL on the agreed KPI's on delivery of samples, Inventory record accuracy and space utilization.Monitor 3PL Reverse Logistics & Return Goods operations on receiving, witnessing/inspection, destruction and reporting, documentation requirements consistent to Abbott RG policy.Audit 3PL security and storage for all return products while awaiting disposal for nutritional powders and destruction for nutritional liquids/pharmaceutical goods. Make sure segregation and standard palletization is being followed in order not to exceed for the allowable pallet storage space.Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)Inventory Record Accuracy (IRA)Transportation and Delivery (TD)3PL Pallet UtilizationShared KPI: Customer Service Level (CSL)Knowledge & SkillsWarehouse and Distribution Management, MRP systemComputer literacyStrong organizational and administration skillsCompetenciesPassionate, eager to learnAbility to work under pressure and to tight schedulesConfident and assertiveProfessional attitude and demeanorAdaptable / Flexible approach to workMinimum QualificationsMinimum of 3 years experience on logistics management within an MRP environmentExcellent understanding of efficient materials flow and best practice.High level of computer literacy, to include MS Power Point, Word, Excel and Outlook
