Job Description   At Roche, 94,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we've become one of the world's leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.At Roche, we work with a purpose - developing innovative tests and medicines, and using data in new ways to help people to live longer, better lives. We have been writing scientific history for more than 120 years, and our work impacts millions of patients every day, now and in the futureRoche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building teams that represent a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.1. The Healthcare System Partner Development Lead missionHealth care is changing: Radical innovation, increased openness to change, increasing patient empowerment, multiple sources of medical information, and pressure on public spending. As a result of all this, the needs of our stakeholders continue to evolve.The Health System Partner- Ecosystem Development Lead is an empowered leader and the local face of Roche working closely with system-level healthcare stakeholders such as policy makers, regulators, and payers.The Healthcare System Development Leadidentifies shared purpose and value, co-creates solutions and co-implements them across ecosystems, indirectly impacting outcomes for thousands of patientsBy doing so the Healthcare System Development Lead will be directly accountable to challenge and shape the healthcare system in service of better health outcomes for more patients faster in a sustainable way to society2. ResponsibilitiesThe Healthcare System Partner Development Lead is able to understand and navigate the healthcare ecosystem in the Philippines. He/she co-creates solutions to increase the level of maturity of SDNs (Service Delivery Networks) together with Patient Journey Partners (Patient Journey Lad) to increase access to SoC (Standard of Care)Adapting Roche Philippines Healthcare Impact Plan for respective ecosystemsDeploy end-to-end (E2E) Access strategies for current and new disease area productsCo creating, leading and implementing policy shaping, access solutions including data enablement for their respective Ecosystems, leveraging synergies across EcosystemsAccountability on delivering outcomes in therapeutic areas within the ecosystemLeverage and support the network and digital solutions to deploy effective engagement and collaboration with partners in the Health system and Patient journey.The Health System Partner- Ecosystem Development LeadPartners with healthcare system stakeholders to drive healthcare system innovation and unlock possibilities to deliver value for the ecosystem and societyThe Health System Partner- Ecosystem Development Lead acts as a trusted partner and the primary (but non-exclusive) point of contact between stakeholders and Roche. She or he shares the stakeholder community vision and value internally, prioritizes and secures resources, and drives solutions that deliver outcomes faster.The Health System Partner- Ecosystem Development Lead lives the Visionary, Architect, Coach, Catalyst (VACC) model, acts as catalyst and coach externally and internally.The Health System Partner- Ecosystem Development Leadlooks across the individual ecosystem and catalyzes our ability to see broader trends and patterns in healthcare systems.They need to be the bridge between external stakeholders and Roche to enable sharing of perspectives, insights and objectives towards more responsive strategies and co-created solutions.The Healthcare System Development Leadwill help drive Personalised Health Care and works with the Patient Journey Lad, supported by other internal functions or the network to deliver solutions to patients.3. Types of Healthcare System Partners (Philippines)A) Health System Partner- Ecosystem Development LeadNational Role(NICCA, DOH, PAGs, PHC, RWE/DSpecific Roles & ResponsibilitiesShapes the prioritization of Roche oncology therapeutic areas, treatments and solutions in the PH healthcare setting, with a priority on NICCA implementation.Elevate value recognition.Shape public funding and healthcare spending decision making and develop mechanisms for reimbursement and government procurement of Roche products.Building on the HIP and PHC strategies.Specific Roles & ResponsibilitiesHandles ophthalmology portfolio and pandemic preparedness, working with both policymakers and HCPs using an end-to-end approach.- for local level policy and access solutions at the SDN clusters: NCR, NCL, SL4. Mindset and BehavioursThe Healthcare System Development Leaddemonstrates personal purpose around improving the healthcare ecosystem, both locally and for Roche more broadly. They think from an Enterprise level, beyond boundaries and borders, in order to bring the best possible outcomes to both the local health environment, and more broadly, across Roche globally.Visionary: defining and embedding the strategy around creating better health outcomes for more patients faster. Able to integrate external and Roche vision into a workable vision of the Philippine health system.Mindset:Strong entrepreneurial mindset with outstanding partnering capabilities (coaching, consulting, ability to deeply listen, question and understand)Growth mindset, able to learn and unlearn quickly, take risks and experiment, and contribute to the learning cycle by sharing knowledge with others inside and outside RocheSelf managed and self directed - altruistic in supporting the global networkDisplay of integrity in everything (i.e. open, honest, ethical and genuine)Enabler mindset leveraging the internal and external networks to create value, sharing back and scaling.Boldly acts on key decisions and opportunities and boldly stops any activity that is not adding value. Ability to say 'No' to stakeholders when the value is not predictable/foreseen.5. Experiences, Knowledge and QualificationsSkills & experience:Senior leader with a deep understanding of healthcare system, processes and governanceExcellent customer engagement and management skillsPrevious market access experience is preferredExperience leading cross functional teams is preferred. Cross-functional leadership experience in both formulating cross-functional strategies and orchestrating cross-functional teams is desirable.System thinker and deep listenerA sensitive leader who senses, reflects and respondsStrong business acumen with desired expertise in commercialization and customer experience excellenceAbility to understand and leverage digital means and tools for the benefit of all stakeholders is highly desirable.Able to manage complex projectsKnowledgeBroad understanding of Roche's present portfolio and future pipeline, such that they can work on future-based solutionsCapabilities:Proficient in English to collaborate internally across the broader Roche enterprise is highly desirable.Able to recommend and implement strategy according to Roche objectives. Preferred Qualifications:University degree (scientific, economic, or business degree). An advanced degree in Life science and/or MBA is a plus.Practical understanding of digital innovation methodologiesEducation in health policyWhy RocheBe part of a winning companyWorking at Roche means working at the forefront of innovation. Our cutting-edge technologies and healthcare solutions are occasionally developed with unconventional methods but always with the highest standard of quality in mind.Our Diagnostic division is the world leader in in-vitro diagnostics.Our Pharmaceutical Division is the No. 1 supplier of cancer medicines.Our Performance CultureAs we keep reinventing ourselves, we depend on our people to take the initiative and push ahead.We look at competencies across functions and geographies, you'll certainly be able to align your interests with our business needs.We believe in having our employees share in the success of the company and offer people the opportunity to take ownership with our employee share plan (currently available in 41 countries).An inspiring work environmentWe foster a culture of debate, mutual respect, and diversity to encourage open discussion and new ideas.Feedback is one of the core elements of our culture, as sharing knowledge promotes the development of new ideas, a key competitive strength of ours.Our focus is on natural, long-term growth, driven by the contributions of our talented and committed people. We leave you the space you need to meet your personal goals, meet your family obligations, and pursue your professional development.We have a variety of site-specific flexible working models.Be inspired by who we are, what we do and how we do it.Visit to learn more about Roche.Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

About Manulife Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of March 31, 2020, we had $1.2 trillion (US$0.8 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $30.4 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as MFC on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under 945 in Hong Kong.Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention and advancement and we administer all of our practices and programs based on qualification and performance and without discrimination on any protected ground. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request any accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Job Description   At Roche, 94,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we've become one of the world's leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.At Roche, we work with a purpose - developing innovative tests and medicines, and using data in new ways to help people to live longer, better lives. We have been writing scientific history for more than 120 years, and our work impacts millions of patients every day, now and in the futureRoche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building teams that represent a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.1. The Patient Journey Partner (PJP) MissionHealth care is changing: Radical innovation, increased openness to change, increasing patient empowerment, multiple sources of medical information, and pressure on public spending. As a result of all this, the needs of our stakeholders continue to evolve.The Patient Journey Partner (PJP) is at the center of the new Roche organization, reiterating our new and evolved role in society - from mostly offering world-class medicines towards much more partnering, innovating and leading health system transformation. By doing so the PJP will be directly accountable to deliver better outcomes for patients, their community, the ecosystem and the organisation, faster.The PJP is an empowered leader and the local face of Roche. She or he partners closely with all stakeholders directly touching the patient journey across Oncology/Hematology and/or Disease Areas gaining a deep understanding of their needs in order to connect Roche's capabilities to co-create meaningful solutions, customized based on the level of maturity of institutions in partnership with HSP based on overall strategic goals.The PJP is a patient journey expert across therapy and disease areas, and is a patient journey strategy owner.This role is locally embedded in the ecosystem, it is an integrated role, functionally agnostic, (i.e. it does not fit into the traditional concepts of Commercial/Sales or Medical Affairs)The PJP works together with other PJPs leveraging synergies across ecosystemsIt has no profitability, sales objectives or incentives2. ResponsibilitiesThe PJP is a senior level role within the country, who has decision making authority to request resources of Roche (both within the country and broader global network) in order to have an improved impact on the patient journey.The PJP acts as a trusted partner and is the primary point of contact for Healthcare Professionals (HCPs) and medical societies in hospital institutions to partner with patient journey stakeholders to remove roadblocks and unlock possibilities to deliver value to patients and the community.The PJP focuses on the importance of bringing the outside in, working with partners to uncover all potential opportunities to transform outcomes for patients, faster. They also bring the inside out, to bring Roche expertise, science and knowledge to the ecosystem.Generates insights from regular market and HCP engagements, including customer visits, market and data analytics, to identify gaps and opportunities, to translate to solutions.Acts as trusted partner and is the primary (but non-exclusive) point of contact between stakeholders and Roche; the PJP shares the patient and stakeholder community needs internally to Roche, prioritizes and secures resources, and drives solutions that deliver outcomes faster.The PJP is a strong contributor, and co-develops the disease and therapy area strategies of the affiliate.Stewards Roche's products through their lifecycle and supports their appropriate use, which includes sharing their merits with HCPs in a truthful and balanced manner. The PJP will help drive Personalized Health Care (PHC) and works with Health System Partners (HSPs) for enablement. One Roche is his/her mindset and is a must-win.By overseeing the patient journey in its entirety, the PJP acts as a system thinker with the ability to identify shared purpose among stakeholders and leverages this to co-create solutions with stakeholders in the ecosystem.Works with key stakeholders to unlock possibilities for patients across the best solutions (i.e. Roche products and treatments, access solutions)Connects ecosystem stakeholders to help them make faster and better treatment decisions.The role is empowered to pull in expertise and resources locally and from the network as needed, including in collaboration with other PJPs and HSPs, Quality, Supply Chain, Finance, etc.Ensuring great experiences whenever stakeholders in the ecosystem engage with Roche employees, products and services.Accountability on delivering outcomes in therapeutic areas within the ecosystem.3. Types of Patient Journey Partners (Philippines)Types of Patient Journey Partners- all Oncology and Hematology promoted brands/products. - all promoted portfolio & disease areas: Oncology, Hematology and Ophthalmology- focused on Ophthalmology portfolio and Pandemic preparedness, with a hybrid scope as a mix of PJP and HSP. Can evolve as the portfolio and needs evolve.4. Mindset & BehaviorsThe PJP demonstrates personal purpose around improving the patient journey, as well as strong passion to create value and impact on the ecosystem. They think from an Enterprise level, beyond boundaries and borders, in order to bring best possible outcomes to both the local health environment, and more broadly, across Roche globally.Visionary: defining and embedding the strategy around creating improved patient journeysMindset:Strong entrepreneurial mindset with outstanding partnering capabilities (coaching, consulting, ability to deeply listen, question and understand)Growth mindset, able to learn and unlearn quickly, take risks and experiment, and contribute to the learning cycle by sharing knowledge with others inside and outside RocheSelf managed and self directed - altruistic in supporting the global networkDisplay of integrity in everything (i.e. open, honest, ethical and genuine)Enabler mindset leveraging the internal and external networks to create value, sharing back and scaling.Boldly acts on key decisions and opportunities and boldly stops any activity that is not adding value. Ability to say 'No' to stakeholders when the value is not predictable/foreseen.5. Experiences, Knowledge and Qualifications Skills and Experience:System thinker and deep listenerExcellent stakeholder engagement skills including partnering with key HCPs and organizations is required. Experience partnering with Patient Groups is highly desired.Experience leading Cross-functional team is preferred. Experience in both formulating cross-functional strategies and orchestrating cross-functional teams is highly desired.Strong business acumen with desired expertise in commercialization, medical and customer experience excellenceAble to understand and leverage digital means and tools is desiredDeep experience in agile ways of working is desiredKnowledge:Deep understanding of patient journey(s) and related treatments in defined disease area(s), enabling engagement at the specialist level.Broad understanding of Roche's present portfolio and future pipeline, such that they can work on future-based solutionsRobust understanding of medical affairs strategies and tactics including clinical researchOther relevant capabilities:Proficient in English to collaborate internally across the broader Roche enterprise is highly desiredPreferred Qualifications:University degree (scientific, economic, or business degree). An advanced degree in Life science and/or MBA is a plus.Practical understanding of digital innovation methodologiesWhy RocheBe part of a winning companyWorking at Roche means working at the forefront of innovation. Our cutting-edge technologies and healthcare solutions are occasionally developed with unconventional methods but always with the highest standard of quality in mind.Our Diagnostic division is the world leader in in-vitro diagnostics.Our Pharmaceutical Division is the No. 1 supplier of cancer medicines.Our Performance CultureAs we keep reinventing ourselves, we depend on our people to take the initiative and push ahead.We look at competencies across functions and geographies, you'll certainly be able to align your interests with our business needs.We believe in having our employees share in the success of the company and offer people the opportunity to take ownership with our employee share plan (currently available in 41 countries).An inspiring work environmentWe foster a culture of debate, mutual respect, and diversity to encourage open discussion and new ideas.Feedback is one of the core elements of our culture, as sharing knowledge promotes the development of new ideas, a key competitive strength of ours.Our focus is on natural, long-term growth, driven by the contributions of our talented and committed people. We leave you the space you need to meet your personal goals, meet your family obligations, and pursue your professional development.We have a variety of site-specific flexible working models.Be inspired by who we are, what we do and how we do it.Visit to learn more about Roche.Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

Job Description: Job Description   Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed  With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.Job DescriptionThe Opportunity The customer is the focus of everything we do, and millions of end users rely on our products daily. We believe in the value of empowering Sales Leaders with the resources to solve critical problems for the future of our business, which is why we need you. Manulife Bancassurance Division is seeking a self-motivated Financial Sales Associate, who is obsessed with delivering value, is forward-thinking, and excited to see the successful client partnerships through the products and services that we offer. What motivates you You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile mindset and enable business outcomes You thrive in teams, and enjoy getting things done togetherYou take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters You do what is right, work with integrity and speak upYou share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone We are looking for someone with: Work experience in bancassurance sales is highly preferred for this position but those with sales and customer service experience gained from banking, transport, pharmaceutical, pre-need, hospitality and IT industries are also encouraged to apply.1 year sales experience preferably in a life insurance settingHas held key positions relevant to the requirement of the jobHigh sense of business ethics and professionalismNice to Have: Strong business and financial acumenExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsPleasing personalityOn the job you will: Work closely with branch sales and service teams to provide innovative product solutions to address clients protection, long-term savings and investment needsStrengthen the long-term relationships with clients by providing excellent customer service Our commitment to you Our mission; to be a part of making Decisions Easier and Lives BetterA leadership team dedicated to your growth and success A bold ambition and set of goals to be a leader in driving transformation in our industry Our best. Every day. Learn more about opportunities with us at jobs.manulife.com    If you are ready to unleash your potential, it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.About ManulifeManulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of September 30, 2020, we had $1.3 trillion (US$943 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $31.2 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as MFC on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under 945 in Hong Kong.Manulife is an Equal Opportunity EmployerAt Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract,develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law. It is our priority to remove barriers toprovide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent withapplicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact [Confidential Information] (mailto:[Confidential Information]).

This can be monthly up to 3-year strategiesEnsure annual targets, manning and active agent count are metResponsible for the strategic planning and growth of the Region by identifying new business opportunities, challenges, and sustainabilityPerform sales forecast on an annual, quarterly, and monthly basis to sustain the business in the assigned region based from data analysis, interpretation and evaluation.Collaborate, build strong relationship with senior leadership of both MCBL and Chinabank to establish and execute sales plans/targets. This can be monthly, quarterly, and annuallyDrives competency development and change managementResponsible for managing risk and compliance for the bank partners sales process and sales activities in the regionManage all area management activities of Area Sales Managers within the designated region through monitoring and sales activity management system.Provide coaching and training to Area Managers and FSAs on Policy Reviews and Fund updates to clients on a monthly/quarterly basisLead, drive, implement, and monitor the Sales Activity Management (SAM) process to the region ensuring strict compliance on sales management activities. This includes coaching and training to AMs and FSAsPerforms Fund Performance Reviews to clients which requires knowledge on the market, economic cycles, and industry’s best practicesResponsible for building a strong customer experience before, during, and after the sale through monthly training and coaching of Area ManagersDevelop Area Managers in people management, area management and relationship building with bank partnersManage FSA hiring based on capacity and business opportunities in the Region.Monitor the FSA recruitment activities of the Area Managers and provide necessary support to attain 100% FSA compliment within the regionSupport the Area Sales Managers in developing a professional relationship with China Bank branch officers and staff and other bank partnersDevelop the management and leadership skills of each of the Area Sales Managers in the region through coaching and trainingAchieve budget projections year on year.Ensure regional and local compliance on Training and mandatory programs in a timely mannerMaintain professional and ethical salesforce at the region level, in line with regulatory, industry and company standardsConducts annual, quarterly, monthly touch points/meetings, planning sessions with salesforce and bank partnersDevelop a strong team and establish succession planning within the regionObserve, analyze, interpret, evaluate, and able to resolve conflicts and banca-related issues within the region ensuring satisfaction from both clients and stakeholdersGenerate and submit all reports requested by management in a timely and accurate mannerOur commitment to you Our mission; to be a part of making Decisions Easier and Lives BetterA leadership team dedicated to your growth and successA bold ambition and set of goals to be a leader in driving transformation in our industryOur best. Job Title: Patient Journey and Health Systems Partner
Job Description: Job Description   At Roche, 94,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we've become one of the world's leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.At Roche, we work with a purpose - developing innovative tests and medicines, and using data in new ways to help people to live longer, better lives. We have been writing scientific history for more than 120 years, and our work impacts millions of patients every day, now and in the futureRoche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building teams that represent a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.1. Ophthalmology & Pandemic Lead MissionHealth care is changing: Radical innovation, increased openness to change, increasing patient empowerment, multiple sources of medical information, and pressure on public spending. As a result of all this, the needs of our stakeholders continue to evolve.The Patient Journey Partner (PJP) is at the center of the new Roche organization, reiterating our new and evolved role in society - from mostly offering world-class medicines towards much more partnering, innovating and leading health system transformation. By doing so the PJP will be directly accountable to deliver better outcomes for patients, their community, the ecosystem and the organisation, faster.The PJP is an empowered leader and the local face of Roche. She or he partners closely with all stakeholders directly touching the patient journey across Oncology/Hematology and/or Disease Areas gaining a deep understanding of their needs in order to connect Roche's capabilities to co-create meaningful solutions, customized based on the level of maturity of institutions in partnership with HSP based on overall strategic goals.The PJP is a patient journey expert across therapy and disease areas, and is a patient journey strategy owner.This role is locally embedded in the ecosystem, it is an integrated role, functionally agnostic, (i.e. it does not fit into the traditional concepts of Commercial/Sales or Medical Affairs)The PJP works together with other PJPs leveraging synergies across ecosystemsIt has no profitability, sales objectives or incentivesHealth care is changing: Radical innovation, increased openness to change, increasing patient empowerment, multiple sources of medical information, and pressure on public spending. As a result of all this, the needs of our stakeholders continue to evolve.The Health System Partner- Ecosystem Development Lead is an empowered leader and the local face of Roche working closely with system-level healthcare stakeholders such as policy makers, regulators, and payers.The Healthcare System Development Leadidentifies shared purpose and value, co-creates solutions and co-implements them across ecosystems, indirectly impacting outcomes for thousands of patientsBy doing so the Healthcare System Development Lead will be directly accountable to challenge and shape the healthcare system in service of better health outcomes for more patients faster in a sustainable way to society2. ResponsibilitiesThe Ophthalmology & Pandemic Lead is a senior level role within the country, who has decision making authority to request resources of Roche (both within the country and broader global network) in order to have an improved impact on the patient journey.Acts as a trusted partner and is the primary point of contact for Healthcare Professionals (HCPs) and medical societies in hospital institutions to partner with patient journey stakeholders to remove roadblocks and unlock possibilities to deliver value to patients and the community.Focuses on the importance of bringing the outside in, working with partners to uncover all potential opportunities to transform outcomes for patients, faster. They also bring the inside out, to bring Roche expertise, science and knowledge to the ecosystem.Generates insights from regular market and HCP engagements, including customer visits, market and data analytics, to identify gaps and opportunities, to translate to solutions.Acts as trusted partner and is the primary (but non-exclusive) point of contact between stakeholders and Roche; shares the patient and stakeholder community needs internally to Roche, prioritizes and secures resources, and drives solutions that deliver outcomes faster.Strong contributor, and co-develops the disease and therapy area strategies of the affiliate.Stewards Roche's products through their lifecycle and supports their appropriate use, which includes sharing their merits with HCPs in a truthful and balanced manner. Help drive Personalized Health Care (PHC) and works with Health System Partners (HSPs) for enablement. One Roche is his/her mindset and is a must-win.By overseeing the patient journey in its entirety, acts as a system thinker with the ability to identify shared purpose among stakeholders and leverages this to co-create solutions with stakeholders in the ecosystem.Works with key stakeholders to unlock possibilities for patients across the best solutions (i.e. Roche products and treatments, access solutions)Connects ecosystem stakeholders to help them make faster and better treatment decisions.The role is empowered to pull in expertise and resources locally and from the network as needed, including in collaboration with other PJPs and HSPs, Quality, Supply Chain, Finance, etc.Ensuring great experiences whenever stakeholders in the ecosystem engage with Roche employees, products and services.Accountability on delivering outcomes in therapeutic areas within the ecosystem.The Healthcare System Partner Development Lead is able to understand and navigate the healthcare ecosystem in the Philippines. He/she co-creates solutions to increase the level of maturity of SDNs (Service Delivery Networks) together with Patient Journey Partners (Patient Journey Lad) to increase access to SoC (Standard of Care)Adapting Roche Philippines Healthcare Impact Plan for respective ecosystemsDeploy end-to-end (E2E) Access strategies for current and new disease area productsCo creating, leading and implementing policy shaping, access solutions including data enablement for their respective Ecosystems, leveraging synergies across EcosystemsAccountability on delivering outcomes in therapeutic areas within the ecosystemLeverage and support the network and digital solutions to deploy effective engagement and collaboration with partners in the Health system and Patient journey.The Health System Partner- Ecosystem Development LeadPartners with healthcare system stakeholders to drive healthcare system innovation and unlock possibilities to deliver value for the ecosystem and societyThe Health System Partner- Ecosystem Development Lead acts as a trusted partner and the primary (but non-exclusive) point of contact between stakeholders and Roche. She or he shares the stakeholder community vision and value internally, prioritizes and secures resources, and drives solutions that deliver outcomes faster.The Health System Partner- Ecosystem Development Lead lives the Visionary, Architect, Coach, Catalyst (VACC) model, acts as catalyst and coach externally and internally.The Health System Partner- Ecosystem Development Leadlooks across the individual ecosystem and catalyzes our ability to see broader trends and patterns in healthcare systems.They need to be the bridge between external stakeholders and Roche to enable sharing of perspectives, insights and objectives towards more responsive strategies and co-created solutions.The Healthcare System Development Leadwill help drive Personalised Health Care and works with the Patient Journey Lad, supported by other internal functions or the network to deliver solutions to patients.3. Types of Patient Journey Partner & Strategy Lead (Philippines)Types of Patient Journey Partners- all Oncology and Hematology promoted brands/products. - all promoted portfolio & disease areas: Oncology, Hematology and Ophthalmology- focused on Ophthalmology portfolio and Pandemic preparedness, with a hybrid scope as a mix of PJP and HSP. Can evolve as the portfolio and needs evolve.A) Health System Partner- Ecosystem Development LeadNational Role(NICCA, DOH, PAGs, PHC, RWE/DSpecific Roles & ResponsibilitiesShapes the prioritization of Roche oncology therapeutic areas, treatments and solutions in the PH healthcare setting, with a priority on NICCA implementation.Elevate value recognition.Shape public funding and healthcare spending decision making and develop mechanisms for reimbursement and government procurement of Roche products.Building on the HIP and PHC strategies.Specific Roles & ResponsibilitiesHandles ophthalmology portfolio and pandemic preparedness, working with both policymakers and HCPs using an end-to-end approach.- for local level policy and access solutions at the SDN clusters: NCR, NCL, SL4. Mindset & BehaviorsThe Ophthalmology & Pandemic Lead demonstrates personal purpose around improving the healthcare ecosystem, both locally and for Roche more broadly. They think from an Enterprise level, beyond boundaries and borders, in order to bring the best possible outcomes to both the local health environment, and more broadly, across Roche globally.Visionary: defining and embedding the strategy around creating better health outcomes for more patients faster. Able to integrate external and Roche vision into a workable vision of the Philippine health system.Mindset:Strong entrepreneurial mindset with outstanding partnering capabilities (coaching, consulting, ability to deeply listen, question and understand)Growth mindset, able to learn and unlearn quickly, take risks and experiment, and contribute to the learning cycle by sharing knowledge with others inside and outside RocheSelf managed and self directed - altruistic in supporting the global networkDisplay of integrity in everything (i.e. open, honest, ethical and genuine)Enabler mindset leveraging the internal and external networks to create value, sharing back and scaling.Boldly acts on key decisions and opportunities and boldly stops any activity that is not adding value. Ability to say 'No' to stakeholders when the value is not predictable/foreseen.5. Experiences, Knowledge and Qualifications Skills and Experience PJP:System thinker and deep listenerExcellent stakeholder engagement skills including partnering with key HCPs and organizations is required. Experience partnering with Patient Groups is highly desired.Experience leading Cross-functional team is preferred. Experience in both formulating cross-functional strategies and orchestrating cross-functional teams is highly desired.Strong business acumen with desired expertise in commercialization, medical and customer experience excellenceAble to understand and leverage digital means and tools is desiredDeep experience in agile ways of working is desiredSenior leader with a deep understanding of healthcare system, processes and governanceExcellent customer engagement and management skillsPrevious market access experience is preferredExperience leading cross functional teams is preferred. Cross-functional leadership experience in both formulating cross-functional strategies and orchestrating cross-functional teams is desirable.A sensitive leader who senses, reflects and respondsStrong business acumen with desired expertise in commercialization and customer experience excellenceKnowledge:Deep understanding of patient journey(s) and related treatments in defined disease area(s), enabling engagement at the specialist level.Broad understanding of Roche's present portfolio and future pipeline, such that they can work on future-based solutionsRobust understanding of medical affairs strategies and tactics including clinical researchOther relevant capabilities:Proficient in English to collaborate internally across the broader Roche enterprise is highly desiredAble to recommend and implement strategy according to Roche objectives. Preferred Qualifications:University degree (scientific, economic, or business degree). An advanced degree in Life science and/or MBA is a plus.Practical understanding of digital innovation methodologiesEducation in health policyWhy RocheBe part of a winning companyWorking at Roche means working at the forefront of innovation. Our cutting-edge technologies and healthcare solutions are occasionally developed with unconventional methods but always with the highest standard of quality in mind.Our Diagnostic division is the world leader in in-vitro diagnostics.Our Pharmaceutical Division is the No. 1 supplier of cancer medicines.Our Performance CultureAs we keep reinventing ourselves, we depend on our people to take the initiative and push ahead.We look at competencies across functions and geographies, you'll certainly be able to align your interests with our business needs.We believe in having our employees share in the success of the company and offer people the opportunity to take ownership with our employee share plan (currently available in 41 countries).An inspiring work environmentWe foster a culture of debate, mutual respect, and diversity to encourage open discussion and new ideas.Feedback is one of the core elements of our culture, as sharing knowledge promotes the development of new ideas, a key competitive strength of ours.Our focus is on natural, long-term growth, driven by the contributions of our talented and committed people. We leave you the space you need to meet your personal goals, meet your family obligations, and pursue your professional development.We have a variety of site-specific flexible working models.Be inspired by who we are, what we do and how we do it.Visit to learn more about Roche.Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
